title: Good Luck
text: A number is called lucky if it consists of only digits 4 and 7 ie. 4, 7, 44, 47 are lucky numbers while 3, 45, 4478 are not lucky. For a given lucky number the functions F(i) and G(i) are defined as followsF(i) = the number of 4’s from 0thto ithposition in the number including positions 0 and i.G(i) = the number of 7’s from 0thto ithposition in the number including positions 0 and i.Let H(i)= absolute(F(i)-F(i+1)-F(i+2)+F(i+3))A "Dynamic Number" is a lucky number which has maximum of summation(H(i)) from i = 0 to n-4 amongst all lucky numbers of length N.Given a number N , you need to find out the sum of the two smallest Dynamic Numbers of length N.If only one Dynamic Number is possible, then only that number is the answer.Note : Most significant bit is defined as the 0thposition of the number.Constraints0 < T <= 1004 <= N <= 10^5InputIt consists of T+1 lines. T denotes the number of test cases. Followed by T lines, each containing one number N.OutputOutput T lines, each containing a number as required.ExampleInput:14Output:8924
